fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update: July 1, 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi all,

Thank you for your feedback and support on this issue.

We’re currently doing research to better understand the impact of this problem. We have actively excluded users who have recently shared with groups however if you experience this issue please email alunnon@atlassian.com.

Regards,
Alex Lunnon
Product Manager, Atlassian 
{panel}

h3. Issue Summary

User is not able to share the page with a group.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a page
 # Choose Share
 # Enter the group name


h3. Expected Results

The group name will appear.

h3. Actual Results

The group name does not appear.


h3. Workaround

Create a team with the same name as the group and share it with the team. You may create the team with the following steps:
# Go to <sitename>.atlassian.net/people 
# Use the Start a team button to get started with a team.
# Add the same users from the group into this team
fields.summary: Not able to share page to group

{panel:title=(i) Bug Fix Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}

h3. Issue Summary

Users are unable to see a page due to an error like below:

{code:none}
Something's gone wrong
Our team has been notified. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Support.

Frontend Version: candidate-649

Error details:
Error: GraphQL error: com.atlassian.confluence.api.service.exceptions.PermissionException: Parent page view is restricted.
{code}

 !graphql-parent-page-view-is-restricted.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

The error only happens if meeting the conditions below:

* the content index is corrupt
* the page you are trying to browse is restricted

h3. Expected Results

The user sees a message saying the page is restricted.

h3. Actual Results

The user sees an error.

h3. Workaround

Contact [us|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/] with referring this issue's URL so that the support engineer can perform the content reindex to suppress the error shortly.
fields.summary: Cannot browse a page due to an error: GraphQL error: ... Parent page view is restricted

fields.description:
*Issue Summary*

The Link does not redirect the user to Anchor's precise location when Anchor and Link are on two different Spaces. 

When a user clicks on the Link associated on Page A, it simply opens the Page B where the Anchor is created but it does not take the user to the precise location on the Page B where Anchor is located.

Note- Page A and Page B are on different Spaces.

 

*Environment*

Confluence Cloud- Old Editor (TinyMCE)

 

*Steps to Reproduce*

 *Step 1-* Create two Spaces with a page in each of them(Page A and Page B).

 *Step 2-* Create a Link on Page A and its respective Anchor on Page B(somewhere down on the page).

 *Step 3-* Click on the Link (on Page A) will redirect you on Page B but will not take you(user) to the precise location(down the page) where Anchor is located.

 

*Expected Results*

Link must redirect user to the precise location of its respective Anchor which is associated on another Page.

 

*Actual Results*

Link simply redirects the user to the page where Anchor is created but does not redirect the user at the precise location of the Anchor on the page.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The Link does not redirect the user to Anchor's precise location when Anchor and Link are on two different Spaces

fields.description:
This is a report created in regards [this recently resolved bug|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-66551] that is still persisting for users.

h3. Summary

Google Drive add-on, by Atlassian, is currently blocking access to files on Drive, saying:
"We can't open this document as XXXX"

 
!google.png|thumbnail!


This seems to have started after 10-May-2019, after the last add-on update.

h3. Environment
 * This seems to happen on new authentications. So revoking authentication from Google's side and then try to reproduce these steps below

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy either a Google Docs/Sheets link
 # Either paste the link directly into the page, or insert a macro by typying "/doc" ("{doc" on the old editor).
 # Authenticate the session via the add-on

h3. Expected Results
 # User should be able to view the doc after the authentication.

h3. Actual Results
# No doc is displayed, instead, a message is displayed as below (no matter how many times you try to authenticate)

h3. Workaround

* If your company uses G Suite, check if the 3rd-party apps are allowed.
https://support.google.com/a/answer/6105699?hl=en
* Tap the *Switch accounts* multiple times. Eventually, the document will be displayed.
fields.summary: [Regression] Google Drive add-on is not allowing users to view documents after authenticating

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

With the [new editing experience|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html], it's no longer possible to edit the settings of the [Task report macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/task-report-macro-724765319.html].

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page/edit an existing one and make sure to insert the *Task report macro*
# When the macro is added, make sure to *edit* it and try to populate the *"Space(s) and Page(s)"* fields

h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to get suggestions in the dropdown autocomplete.

h3. Actual Results

No suggestions are displayed.

h3. Notes
* The Assignee and Creator fields continue to work properly.
* This has the same symptoms from [this resolved bug in the new editor|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-65666] and also, [this older one for the Legacy editor|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-56002].

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Cannot edit settings of Task Report macro in the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When inserting a JIRA Issue/Filter macro inside a table, it will add a large amount of blank space to the column, increase considerably the width of the table.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page
 # Add a table to the page
 # In the second column, insert a JIRA Issue/Filter macro using JQL that will populate issues
 # Under display options, select just Key and Summary
 # Set the table to Full Width via the button at the top right of the table
 # Publish the page

h3. Expected Results

The macro should be displayed correctly and shouldn't increase the width of the column to a huge size
h3. Actual Results

The column where the macro is will have a large amount of blank space, increasing considerably the width of the table:
   |  !jira_macro_table.gif|width=900!  |
h3. Workaround

Currently the only workaround is to place the Jira macro outside of the table. A different workaround will be added here once available.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue/Filter macro inside a table adds a large amount of blank space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some API requests made by Connect apps, either using [JWT|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/understanding-jwt/] or [OAuth 2.0 JWT Bearer Token|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/oauth-2-jwt-bearer-tokens-for-apps/] authentication, are treated as anonymous requests.

h3. Environment

?

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Make an API request as a Connect app.

h3. Expected Results

The request is processed, acting as the app's system user or as an impersonated user.

h3. Actual Results

The request is treated as an anonymous request.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Some Connect app API requests are treated as anonymous requests

h3. Summary

When logging into _id.atlassian.com_ with Safari, after several redirects user is shown "atlassian.io" page with an error message "*Safari can't open the page* because Safari can't establish a secure connection to the server "atlassian.io".
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Try to access id.atlassian.com
h3. Expected Results

User logins successfully
h3. Actual Results

Error message is shown "Safari can't open the page"
h3. Workaround

Even after Safari shows an error, user is logged in. Try to access Jira / Confluence or any other Atlassian Product using direct URL and it will be working just fine.

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Bug Fix Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}

At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
 You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

When editing a certain type of macro, users can overwrite the macro itself by mistake, especially if using an [IME|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Input_method]. The problem can be severe, where users spend a lot of time to make changes in the macro modal such as for the Roadmap Planner.
h3. Environment

Verified with these macros:
 * Roadmap Planner: [https://youtu.be/cVvTHMR5G0k]
 * Table of Content: [https://youtu.be/FE1qFeyoHkc]

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Suppose you use a Roadmap Planner. It can happen to a similar type of other macros such as the Table of Contents macro.
 # Create a page with the old editor (cf. [the new editor|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html])
 # Insert a roadmap planner macro once
 # Edit the inserted roadmap planner
**  !Screenshot 2019-06-07 13.31.01.png|thumbnail! 
 # Focus back to on the editor (this can happen accidentally such as in case you use [Google Japanese IME|https://www.google.co.jp/ime/]; but you can type tab-key several times to intentionally reproduce the behavior)
 # Type something

h3. Expected Results

Remove the focus to the macro before launching the macro's modal so that users won't mistakenly edit the page.
 This is the behavior other macros do such as Iframe macro and Info macro, which can reduce a chance to lose the content by accident.
h3. Actual Results

Since the macro is focused on the editor, the macro can be removed by mistake.
h3. Workaround

Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email. Until then,


* Create a page with the new editor.
**  !Screenshot 2019-06-07 15.24.28.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Macro can be easily overwritten by accident

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Feature request raised from DEVHELP:

It would be great to have the following options in the Copy Page Tree REST resource,
# Add suffix

h3. Background
See conversation below:

To give more context, this feature request is also related to our app Scroll Documents as mentioned in the other tickets.

Please find the requested information below:
 * Use cases, scenarios, and benefits:
The copy page tree operation is the fundamental operation and one of the core features of our app. As a means to make it more powerful and provide users with more flexibility, we would need these additional options. By flexibility, we mean that in many of our operations we use the copy page tree operation to have multiple copies of pages, and page trees in the same space. Many of the times, prefixes can get long and when looking for the pages in the page tree, it can become quite cumbersome.

* Which particular REST endpoint were you referring to?
{code}
POST /wiki/rest/api/content/<id>/pagehierarchy/copy
{code}
*  "Add suffix" - add suffix to what and how does this help you?
 From our user studies/tests, we found that many users preferred to use postfix when copying a page hierarchy. This option also improves the readability of the Confluence Page Tree.
fields.summary: Add suffix option to the copy page tree operation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. User Management and Billing links are broken in Confluence

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# From the Confluence homepage click Settings.  
# Now Click User Management or Billing under Site Administration

h3. Expected Results
You are navigated to User Management or Billing section.

h3. Actual Results
You get a 404 error

h3. Notes
# The URLs are malformed. 
# User management link tries to navigate to https://<cloudsite>.atlassian.net/wiki<cloudsite>.atlassian.net/admin/users where as it should navigate to https://<cloudsite>.atlassian.net/admin/users
# Billing link tries to navigate to https://<cloudsite>.atlassian.net/wiki<cloudsite>.atlassian.net/admin/billing/overview where as it should navigate to https://<cloudsite>.atlassian.net/admin/billing/overview

h3. Workaround
Navigate 
# User management from https://<cloudsite>.atlassian.net/admin/users and 
# Billing from https://<cloudsite>.atlassian.net/admin/billing/overview
fields.summary: User Management and Billing links are broken in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When clicking a user's mention on a page, instead of being redirected to the user's profile on "People" section of the instance, you'll get a page not "Page Not Found"
h3. Environment
 * This behavior is present on the Old Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Insert an @ mention an user (e.g. @Alegra in my case)
 # Click the user's mention;
 !user mention.gif|width=890,height=697!

h3. Expected Results

You should be redirected to the user's profile on "People" section of the instance
h3. Actual Results
 * User is redirected to [https://<Your instance>.atlassian.net/people/<user's hash>?ref=confluence] and you'll get "Page Not Found"
 * Note for the "?ref=confluence" part

h3. Notes
 * To reproduce this issue make sure to clear the browser's cache, as this BUG will not be triggered if you already visited the user's profile and have cached data on them.

h3. Workarounds
 # Removing the "*?ref=confluence*" part from the user's profile URL will correctly load the page. The link should look like [https://<Your instance>.atlassian.net/people/<user's hash>]
 # Instead of clicking the user's mention, hover over their name and a pop-up will appear > Click *View Profile* Button.
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-05 at 17.32.58.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: "Page not found" when clicking a user's mention on a page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a Team Space, sometimes the overview page breaks, showing some errors in preview and editing mode.
h3. Environment
 * Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new space from Team Space blueprint.

h3. Expected Results

The space is created healthy, without any issue.
h3. Actual Results

The space is created with the overview page broken on backend.

Preview mode:

!image-2019-06-05-15-08-45-173.png|width=470,height=126!

Editing mode:

!image-2019-06-05-15-09-14-307.png|width=442,height=110!
h3. Notes

We already have multiple issues involving this blueprint:
 * CONFCLOUD-66544 - Space created from Team space blueprint shows an error
 * CONFCLOUD-66621 - Team Space Overview shows an error icon instead of the Overview content

They are all linked with an internal ticket.
h3. Workaround
Recreate the space using the blank space option instead of a team space.
fields.summary: Team Space Overview page showing errors on preview and editing mode

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary Adding more than one team member during Team space creation causes the Overview page to break h3. Environment Fabric - Team Spaces h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a New Space # Select Team Space as template # In the Team Members list, add one more person to the list h3. Space is created with the overview page showing all the team members in the appropriate section. h3. Actual Results On the UI the Overview page doesn't load and a "We couldn't display your content" error is thrown. Browser Developer Tools shows 401s and {noformat} ContentRenderer.tsx:24 Invalid adf document SyntaxError: Unexpected token < in JSON at position 0 at JSON.parse () at pe (ContentRenderer.tsx:21) at Object.children (ContentRenderer.tsx:66) at n (react-apollo.esm.js:348) at t.render (react-apollo.esm.js:352) at Ii (react-dom.production.min.js:173) at Ti (react-dom.production.min.js:172) at Pi (react-dom.production.min.js:180) at Ga (react-dom.production.min.js:232) at Wa (react-dom.production.min.js:233) {noformat} h3. Notes The Macro that is used to render the profiles seems to accept a single user as a parameter, and the error seems to be caused by it being fed more than one user's account. The error message can be seen in the body of the page as well (Storage Format): e.g.: Error parsing storage content: '


' h3. Workaround 1. Recreate the space using the blank space blueprint/template instead of a team space blueprint/template. OR 2. Create a new page and set it as the overview page in the space settings page. Move other subpages from the problematic page to the new page in the content manager page.
fields.summary: Adding more than one team member during Team space creation causes the Overview page to break

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, it's not possible to render an external gadget from Jira in a Confluence page.
h3. Environment
 * Fabric

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a blank page
 # Use the "+" and search for external gadget (Jira issue calendar, Created Vs Resolved Gadget)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Confluence, if the user restricts a page for groups with an uppercase letter, members of the group will not be able to find the page on the sidebar, or, search for the same while using the quick search feature.
h3. Steps to Reproduce:
 # As a *site-admin* of the application, make sure to create a new group that will be using uppercase letters through [https://site.atlassian.net/admin]. For example, "testiNG".
 # With the created group (and also, the *Application Access* granted for the same, if needed), make sure to add specific users to the same.
 # Now, in Confluence, access a child page from the Home page of a space and *restrict* the same for the created group.
 # Ask one of the group members to access the page by sending the link
 # Ask them to check the sidebar and also, try to search for it.

h3. Expected Results

The page should be searchable and displayed in the correct hierarchy on the sidebar.
h3. Actual Results

Only the Home page link is displayed on the sidebar and the page is not findable. If expanding the home link, the page will not be listed.
h4. Notes

Note that specific pages under the same condition may not face the same behavior. However, if removing all the restrictions, and then, re-configuring the bug scenario, the issue will affect those pages as well. This seems that only new added restrictions may cause the issue to happen, which is why the steps to reproduce will always make the user reproduce the bug.

The following error is logged on the browser's console:

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 11-Oct-2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,
 
Thank you for your feedback on adding page anchors into the new editor. We currently have link to headings that are natively supported in the new editor without the need for the old Anchor Macro. You can directly reference headers by copying the link upon hover or by adding #Header-Name to the URL of your page. With our originally announced plan to clean up macros (https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/we-re-cleaning-up-our-macros-946028471.html) and our implementation of link to headings, we currently have no plans in the near term to bring back the Anchor Macro in its original state. 

You can track our upcoming roadmap here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-cloud-editor-roadmap-967314556.html. If we have any updated plans, we will update the thread here. Thank you again for your feedback.

Best,

Sunny
{panel}


According to Atlassian Documentation here:
[Confluence Editing Improvements|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html#ConfluenceEditingImprovements-Anchors]

Anchors have been removed from the new editing experience and we intend to re-add it at some point in the future.
I am creating this feature request to provide a public-facing location for users to track this specific feature.
fields.summary: Add Page Anchors back into the new editor experience.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we use the Page Tree macro on a column made of two columns, if one of the listed pages contains more than around 30 characters, instead of the page get listed in a line, it wraps the title in two lines, instead of one (when it has enough space to continue in just a line). 

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have some pages on a space with the title containing more than around 30 characters;
# Of these pages, put some of them under another page;
# Insert the Page Tree macro inside a Column, starting from the 2 depth;
# Fill the other blank Column with random content;
# Get the Columns with full-width.

h3. Expected Results
The listed topics from the Page Tree should be presented all in a single line while the column has enough space.

h3. Actual Results
The listed pages from the Page Tree get in two-lines, even the column having enough space to continue in a single line.

h3. Notes
This issue occurs eventually, not 100% of the times.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Page Tree macro doesn't use the correct space when on a Column

The user saves search URL link and link to their text on their page. When clicking on the text, it's showing Page Not Found.

 # Click the search field in the top-left of Confluence to open the search panel (the magnifying glass)
 # Click Advanced search on the left side of the search panel, or, tap enter for the search, so you can go to the *Advanced Search* .

Page not found will be shown

fields.description:
When working with the creation of spaces in Confluence (specifically, the first space created by a user), some attachments like pictures will be added to complete the first space template creation.

When the operation is complete, if the user navigates to the dashboard of Confluence (activities), these attachments are tracked as being uploaded by anonymous users and the user that created the space. While this happens because the system uploaded the attachments, the information should point that Confluence itself has made the upload in order to avoid confusion for the users.

This is a suggestion to display that the uploads were made by the system/Confluence and not the user/anonymous for accuracy purposes.
fields.summary: Improve accuracy for system attachments upload

{panel:title=(i) Bug Fix Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}

h3. Issue Summary

When a user edits Roadmap Planner with [IME|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Input_method], typing *enter* (return key) to select a candidate from the IME, which unexpectedly exits editing mode. It can occur to most CJK users.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

Assuming you're going to type *日本語の文章*:

# Enable [IME|https://www.google.co.jp/ime/]
# First type a Japanese string: *にほんごの*
# Then try to convert *にほんごの* to *日本語の* by using the IME function
# When you press down the enter key to select *日本語の*, the focus exits from the input area 
# To input the following characters, you need to select the edit button once again

 !Screenshot 2019-06-03 16.28.17.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

After you pressed down *enter* (return key) to select a candidate from the IME, the focus remains in the input area, and the editor is available.

h3. Actual Results

After you pressed down *enter* (return key) to select a candidate from the IME, the editor exits from the input area.

h3. Note

IME-aware API
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/IME_handling_guide

h3. Workaround

Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
Until then,

* you can select a candidate from the IME by keeping typing the next characters without pressing *enter* (return key)
** https://youtu.be/junGxuMWeyA
fields.summary: Roadmap Planner doesn't work well with IMEs

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update 18 April 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}

We are planning on shipping new capabilities to the panel macro soon to improve your experience with Panels. You will be able to choose any colour from our colour palette instead of the predefined ones, you will be able to remove the panel icon altogether or add different/custom icons “emojis” to the panel other than the predefined ones. 
 
Thanks,
Yousef

{panel}


{panel:title=Status Update 13 March 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}

As we're working through this feature and others, we wanted to address a lot of your concerns as to the future of the new editor and legacy editor.

Please read our recent community post here: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-Cloud-articles/Change-to-your-content-is-in-your-hands/ba-p/1324476

Thanks,
Avinoam

{panel}

h3. *Problem Statement*

"old" panel macro was much more fully featured as border styles, text styles and titles etc could be specified.
h3. *Suggestion*

Having the feature from the old and in addition to the new predefined ones, or one that could provide both the new templates and the existing functionality would be great.

 

From CONFCLOUD-65659:
h3. Problem Definition

The new macro called *Panel* in the new editor allows users to contextually switch between:
 * Info - {color:#0000ff}Blue{color}
 * Note - {color:#800080}Purple{color}
 * Success - {color:#008000}Green{color}
 * Warning - {color:#ffa500}Orange{color}
 * Error - {color:#ff0000}Red{color}

!Screenshot 2019-08-22 at 11.50.14.png|thumbnail!

There's no option for the user to choose on their own which of the icons or colors show, or if they want an icon to show at all.
h3. Suggested Solution

Customers should be able to edit/change/set the background color for panel macro and choose if they want to display an icon.
h3. Why this is important

The customer wants to customize the panel macro, which they are not able to do because of the new editor changes.
h3. Workaround

No current workaround, but I've used the new Layout feature mentioned in [Confluence Editing Improvements|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html] to display as a panel of my own.
fields.summary: Bring back the original panel macro feature

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When backspacing through the any bulleted item in a bulleted list while using Google Chrome, the whole list is removed instead of just the last bullet.

h3. Environment
Behavior confirmed on:
- Google Chrome

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit or create a page
 # create a bulleted list
 # backspace through any of the bulleted items such that the bullet would normally be removed.

h3. Expected Results
 The bullet is removed.

h3. Actual Results
The whole list is removed.

h3. Notes
This behavior can also cause content above and below the bulleted list to be removed as well.

h3. Workaround
The following will allow you to remove the bullet and leave the list:
- Use another browser, such as Firefox
- Use shift + back-arrow to select through the bullet to be removed, then hit backspace to remove just that bullet.
- use the mouse to select the text up to the end of the previous bullet, then backspace.
fields.summary: hitting backspace through any bullet item in Confluence page editor deletes whole list on Chrome

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the Canadian French keyboard, the *@* doesn't work on Confluence.

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* Windows

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set your keyboard preference to Canadian French;
# Edit a Confluence page;
# Try to insert the *@* on the page (CTRL + ALT + 2).

h3. Expected Results
After using the keyboard commands, the *@* character is inserted.

h3. Actual Results
Confluence formatting is changed.

h3. Notes
In other products, it is working (like JIRA, for example).

h3. Workaround

h3. Issue Summary

When using /rest/api/content/{id}/notification/child-created to get the watchers of a page, the results or watchers don't update when a second user clicks on "Watch all pages in space" which automatically ticks the "Watch Page" checkbox. However, when only the "Watch Page" is ticked off, the results are updated

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# User 1 creates a page
# User 2 goes to the previously created page and clicks on "Watch all content in this space" which automatically ticks the "Watch Page"
# Call REST API https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-content-id-notification-child-created-get
# Notice that the results are not updated
# Try unticking the watchers and just click on "Watch Page", notice that the results are updated

h3. Expected Results
Watchers are updated
h3. Actual Results
Watchers remain the same


h3. Notes
* Replication video is added as an internal comment for privacy of accountIds

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Rest api for get content watchers' results does not update when user clicks on "Watch all pages in space"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In meeting notes, when highlighting a text and proceed to create issue.
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-29 at 12.26.23 PM.png|thumbnail!

The Jira link does not show up in the meeting note page as how it is expected in other pages such as blank page template :
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-29 at 12.27.23 PM.png|thumbnail!

However, the issue does get created in Jira.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In meeting note, highlight a text and click on create an issue
 # Proceed to create the issue and keep a note of the summary of the issue

h3. Expected Results

The Jira link should show up on top of the meeting note page
h3. Actual Results

Does not show the JIRA Link
h3. Notes

The issue does gets created in Jira but the link does not show up in the meeting note page.
h3. Workaround
 # Edit the meeting note.
 # On the text that you initially wanted to link to Jira, place the cursor at the end of the text
 # Click on + on the top and choose Jira
 # This should show a pop-up box for Jira, then proceed to click on "Create new issue"
 # Search for the project that you wish to create and proceed to add it
 # Once added, publish the page

fields.description:
{panel:title= Bug Fix Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
 You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

Mentions feature doesn't work in a specific condition due to the dependency of the deprecated key event.
h3. Environment

Some browser (such as Safari on macOS Mojave) no longer fires _onkeypress_ event with certain IMEs (such as [Japanese Input Method|https://support.apple.com/guide/japanese-input-method/welcome/mac]):
 * macOS Mojave 10.14.x
 * Safari 12.x

 !NG Setting 2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Select [Japanese Input Method|https://support.apple.com/guide/japanese-input-method/welcome/mac]
 # Open a page with Safari on macOS Mojave
 # Try mentions feature

 [^2019-05-29_11.41.38.mov.zip] 

h3. Expected Results

Mentions feature works with any [supported browsers|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/supported-browsers-744721663.html].
h3. Actual Results

Mentions feature doesn't work with Safari using certain IMEs.
h3. Notes

The suspected root cause is a use of the deprecated key event named _onkeypress_.
 [https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/GlobalEventHandlers/onkeypress]

Mentions feature works as expected with [the new editor|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html].


h3. Workaround

Switch to other IME such as [Google Japanese Input|https://www.google.co.jp/ime/].

 !OK Setting 2.png|thumbnail! 

 Also consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Use `onkeydown` with mentions feature instead of the depricated `onkeypress`

fields.description:
Currently, we are able to use iframe to show other webpages on Confluence (like SharePoint, using an add-on or even other webpages, using the iframe macro). 
However, due to the same-origin policy (set through the {{X-Frame-Options}} HTTP response header), we cannot do the opposite. 
Allowing this on Confluence should provide a better user experience the user since Confluence becomes more integrated with different tools.
fields.summary: Allow to iframe Confluence in other sites

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Confluence should have an option to create users for being used exclusively on API, and such users shouldn't count towards licensing, that is customers shouldn't pay for users that are only used for development purposes through the application's API and do not access the application's "regular features" using a browser.
h3. Suggested Solution
Have an option to create a user with exclusive access to the API that won't be charged.
h3. Why this is important
Atlassian is a company that helps developers, among many other teams, but developers mostly, and Atlassian's mission is to "advance humanity through the power of software" [1], so creating barriers to automation is being developer-unfriendly.

[1] https://www.atlassian.com/company
h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Allow users used exclusively on API scripts to have free access

None.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using the new editor, pasting markdown code will only convert it to the respective styled text depending on the source the code was copied.
h3. Environment

New editor and Old editor
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy the code below
{code:none}
Heading
=======

## Sub-heading

Paragraphs are separated
by a blank line.

Two spaces at the end of a line  
produces a line break.

Text attributes _italic_, 
**bold**, `monospace`.

Horizontal rule:

---

Bullet list:

  * apples
  * oranges
  * pears

Numbered list:

  1. wash
  2. rinse
  3. repeat

A [link][example].

  [example]: http://example.com

![Image](Icon-pictures.png "icon")

> Markdown uses email-style > characters for blockquoting.{code}
 # Paste it on a page with the new editor

h3. Expected Results

The code should be converted to styled text
h3. Actual Results

Depending on the source, it will not convert. 
 E.g.: Copying from Sublime text editor, it will work, but not from the terminal (vim).

h3. Notes
- At some point drop down for the type of markup was not honored on insert

h3. Workaround

Copy the code to a text editor first (e.g. sublime text) and then insert the code on the page.
fields.summary: Pasting markdown code won't convert it depending on the source

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The profile picture of a deleted user is still showing in the last contributors list of a page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a least two users with a profile picture editing a page
# Delete one of the user from the site
 
h3. Expected Results
The deleted user's profile picture wouldn't show in the page's last contributors list, and it would show an empty circle indicating a former user.
h3. Actual Results
The profile picture of the deleted user still shows up in the list.
h3. Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Deleted user picture still showing in the page last contributors list

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Make inline comment

 # Click the comment and type some text to leave reply

 # Click 'Save' button and hover over User Name

*Expected result:* one pop-up with account data appears
*Actual result:* two pop-ups with account data appear
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Two pop-ups with account data appear when leaving reply to inline comment

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Livesearch Macro doesn't render on Confluence Cloud Mobile App
h3. Environment

Confluence in mobile browser
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Page
 # Add a Livesearch macro to it
 # Access this page through the mobile browser

h3. Expected Results

The page should load and the macro should appear.
h3. Actual Results

The macro doesn't appear on the page.
h3. Workaround

Use the mobile app and set the Livesearch as 'medium'.
fields.summary: Livesearch Macro doesn't render on mobile browser

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a table within a page, the table doesn't show up in mobile browser after publishing the page.
h3. Environment

Mobile browser (Safari and Google Chrome)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and create a simple table within it
 # Publish the page
 # Access the page using the mobile browser

h3. Expected Results

The content should be rendered within the table.
h3. Actual Results

The content shows up on the page, but without the lines and columns.
h3. Workaround

Use the mobile application available at [Apple Store|https://itunes.apple.com/br/app/confluence-cloud/id1006971684?mt=8] or [Google Play|https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.atlassian.android.confluence.core&hl=en_US].
fields.summary: Tables aren't rendered in mobile browser

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we click on the share button and insert an e-mail address that is not from a Confluence user, the destination doesn't receive the notification in his/her mailbox.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access an existing page;
# Click over the share button (right top side of the screen);
# Add an external and valid e-mail address not related to any existing user in the instance;
# Add an existing user also and share it.

h3. Expected Results
All the destinations receive a notification with the page link that was shared.

h3. Actual Results
Only the Confluence user receives the notification in his/her mailbox, containing the shared page link.

h3. Workaround
Copy the page link and manually send the e-mail to the e-mail address you wish to share this page.
fields.summary: Share Page with external e-mail address doesn't send the notification

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you add a Panel to Answer to a Question, the Panel is visible in Edit Model but not in normal mode.
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud (Not Editor specific)
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Get ‘Questions for Confluence’ from Market Place.
 2. Open it. Click on ‘Ask Question’.
 3. Use Panel by clicking on ‘+’. (Panel will be visible)
 4. Click ‘Save’. Panel will disappear (not content).
h3. Expected Results

Content must be visible inside the panel.
h3. Actual Results

Content appears without the panel.
h3. Workaround

No workaround for now.
fields.summary: Questions for Confluence- If you add a Panel to Answer to a Question, the Panel is visible in Edit Model but not in normal mode.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Searching for users via [Search|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-search-get] REST API with a limit greater than 100 returns only a result set with size 100 (even if there are more than 100 users) and with incorrect {{totalSize}}. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Search for users via {{/wiki/rest/api/search?cql=type=user&start=0&limit=1000}} or {{/wiki/rest/api/search?cql=type in (user)&start=0&limit=1000}}

h3. Expected Results
The API should return the limit that is being used

h3. Actual Results
Searching for users, the API returns a maximum of 100 items and gives off an incorrect {{totalSize}}

h3. Notes
* In the past, searching for users allow a 1000-item limit but currently, it looks that it only accepts 100
* Searching for other types other than _user_ still works as expected

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Searching users via /wiki/rest/api/search returns incorrect limit and totalSize

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After creating a Team Space, the overview page gets an error. When you try to edit the page, this error is actually an icon attached to the page.
 Accessing the storage format to check it, and there is no register of this icon + the storage format is made of the overview page from Team Space.
h3. Environment
 * Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Team Space;
 # Check if the overview page has the error icon.

h3. Expected Results

The Team Space's overview page is loaded.
h3. Actual Results

The Team Space's overview page shows only an error icon.

!image-2019-06-05-15-47-28-786.png|width=232,height=107!
h3. Notes
 * We couldn't find a way to reproduce this situation;
 * It might be related to CONFCLOUD-66544

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Team Space Overview shows an error icon instead of the Overview content

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating a JIRA Report macro with Change Logs, the issues related to this report are being shown listed with too many weird spaces.

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a previous project created on JIRA, with some issues created, containing fixing versions;
# Go to Confluence and add a page using the JIRA Report template;
# Select the Change Log;
# Select the Project and Fix version of the report;
# Create the page.

h3. Expected Results
The report is generated listing the JIRA issues correctly.

h3. Actual Results
The JIRA issues on the report are messed up with spaces that are not supposed to be there.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JIRA Report (Change Log) adding too many weird spaces between the issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Macro does not show up in PDF export

h3. Environment
Confluence-Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a page.
2. Add a macro named- ‘Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Macro shows a text in PDF export’.
3. Publish the page.
4. Export the page in PDF format.
5. You will see the image with error- ‘Gadgets can only be viewed in browsers’.

h3. Expected Results
Content used in the macro must appear exactly.

h3. Actual Results
Instead of the appropriate content(the macro), image with error- ‘Gadgets can only be viewed in browsers’ appears.

h3. Workaround
No workaround till now.
fields.summary: Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Macro shows an image with the error in PDF export instead of the actual table.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The page tree width is too small on the new editor

h3. Environment
Confluence cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a confluence page on the new editor
# Add a page tree with one or more pages
# Publish

h3. Expected Results
The page tree macro gets created while making use of the page width

h3. Actual Results
The page tree macro gets created but uses a small width

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The page tree macro width is too small on the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If any of the table-based macros or the roadmap planner is set to wide on the editor, it wont take effect after publishing the page.

h3. Environment
New editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with the new editor
# Insert a macro e.g. roadmap planner
# Set it to Full Width
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
It should be published as full width

h3. Actual Results
the macro is published as normal width:
|  !wide_macros_cr.gif!  |

h3. Notes
This was noticed on the roadmap planner, JIRA Issue/Filter macros

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Setting a macro to wide doesn't change it in view mode on the new editor
